course.subject: LIFS
course.name: Neurochemistry
course.description: Introduction to the molecular understanding of brain function, building upon the basis of biochemistry and biology.  Four specific themes are covered: (i) structural neurochemistry and neural membranes; (ii) synapses, transmitters and receptors; (iii) cellular and (iv) medical and behavioral neurochemistry.

reviews.author: 孤獨的美食家
reviews.title: [Chi + Eng] 4 Yr2 vs 2X Yr3 (ALE+DSE)
reviews.comment_content:
Anatomy of Neuronal system
From system level down to cellular level.
Parts of Brain, Types of tissues, types of neurons, types of signal transduction system
Different types of Neurotransmitter and receptors, different familiar neuronal diseases (e.g. AD, and different psychological disease)
Mechanism of memorizing

好多野記，背唔晒。
MIDTERM OPENBOOK
FINAL CLOSE BOOK
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kenny Chung is a funny local Professor. His presentation skills are acceptable. But due to the limitation of content, he has to skip some parts from his PPT and read aloud some of them.

He will further elaborate the contents on his PPT, and talk something about his own experiments on the similar contents. He will also talk about the effects of different drugs on the neuronal system detaily.

HEA底，極HEA。PROJECT PRESENT時基本上你講緊，佢玩緊手機（但其實又真係有聽到，佢會問番D關於你PROJECT PRESENT漏左嘅野）
但係有野唔明你落堂/BREAK問佢佢會詳細覆你

可以走堂 因為佢係讀PPT重點+少少解釋+SIDE TRACK課外野
我走堂走到佢認得我
走左2星期之後上番堂佢望一望我跟住笑一笑“oh, hi" 勁老尷

最經典係最後一堂講FINAL內容，佢用左15分鐘講完就落堂
佢一準備擰轉身走果時就有人遲到行入課室
跟住佢指一指條友，跟住“哈哈哈哈哈”
（勁仆街但係好好笑）
跟住同條友講"Our lesson has just finished, you can go back now."跟住繼續笑

如果有心機聽佢喺讀PPT之外講嘅野會發覺佢識好多藥理嘅野
好多唔同藥嘅副作用、MECHANISM佢都講到比你知

因為10點半堂，有堂訓著左
坐到對正佢，跟住我一起身佢對住我微笑 LOL
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm below 0.3SD
Project below 1/20 marks
Final [No stat]
Overall C+

少人COURSE 應該係ABSOLUTE？
真心唔清楚

在場得4個YR2（包括本食家）
其它全部都係YR3，嚇死我
reviews.comment_workload:
Acceptable
2 Assignments, review on a nobel lecture
Link will be given by Prof, within one A4 page. 5% each

Project, 3 in a team 25%
Presentation on famous drugs, eg cocaine, ketamine
about their effects, origin, etc, whatever you want to say
The topic given is only "Cocaine" or "Ketamine", etc
Ask for instruction from Prof. Chung, he replies ' Whatever you would like to say.'

Midterm open book, open notebook but no network 25%
(Prof will stay at the back of the classroom to see whether you open the browser or not)

Final Close book, challenging (even Yr3 say so) 45%
Not only memorizing but also understanding about the contents. LQ + MC

reviews.author: J.T.
reviews.title: DO NOT take this unless you are really interested in neuro
reviews.comment_content:
1 Introduction to neurochemistry.

2 Neurotransmitters and receptors in the nervous system.

3 Acetylcholine.

4 Catecholamine.

5 Amino acids.

6 Neuropeptides.

7 Gaseous molecules as neurotransmitters.

8 Neurochemistry of addiction.

9 Neurochemistry of narcotics and commonly abused drugs.

10 Neurochemical basis of learning, memory and behavior.

11 Pathogenic mechanism of neurological diseases.

12 Novel approaches in the treatment of neurological disorders.

The content is interesting, but his teaching ruined everything(see Teaching part)

Due to COVID, classes are given through online/mixed-mode. The mt and final were also held through canvas.
reviews.comment_teaching:
TBH, I don't like his course at all. The ppt is messy. Some pages are full of detailed sentences but some pages only have a picture. His explanation is also vague. Sometimes simply read ppt out. There is nearly no way to figure out which part is important. I really struggled when I prepared for finals. Definitely not recommend this course, there are better electives to choose.

He is willing to discuss with students though. Responsive to questions during classes.
reviews.comment_grading:
- grading scheme
10% assignment: two essays, summarize two videos, both Nobel lectures from Nobel laureates, one page long, as long as you submit, you have full marks

25% midterm: 40 questions in 25 minutes, T/F and MC, open book, it is crazy.

25% group project: 5-6 ppl a group, allowed to choose group mates, each group was assigned a topic, we need to prepare a 10 min presentation and 5 min Q&A sessions, the questions all come from other students. 20% grading of this part is peer evaluation. the topic include:  Neuro-circuitry of addiction, Cocaine, Heroin, Marijuana, Nicotine, Alcohol, LSD, MDMA, Methamphetamine, Bath salts(synthetic cathinones), Ketamine

40% final: it is INSANE!!! open book, 70 questions in 40 mins, 44 one point T/F, 26 two points multiple answer MC(can be one or more correct answers, no partial points). He even didn't tell us how many questions he had until the beginning of the exam. Although it is open book, really have no time to look it up. You had better treat it as a close book exam and try to memorize as much as you can. (actually, the midterm is similar, just treat it as a close book exam)

- my grade: 10/10 for two essays, 38/40 for mt(high 40, mean 32.2, low 17), project and final unknown, A eventually.
reviews.comment_workload:
Before mt, the content is not hard. It might be helpful if you took LIFS3240. (I didn't, but my friend told me some contents are overlapped)
After mt, he started to talk about neurotransmitters which are far more complicated for me. Need to work hard if you want a good grade.

reviews.author: Liquid Science
reviews.title: Not a bad choice as an elective
reviews.comment_content: The content covered was as advertised in the description of the course - useful to know and understand but not too complicated for undergrads that may not work on neurochemistry later.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor's teaching style is not at all boring. The lecture often includes some discussions with students and some video watching from time to time. He also elaborate and slow the pace down when students found it hard to catch up.
reviews.comment_grading: As long as you spent time and effort in preparing for the exam and presentation, it is not hard to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Average for a science course - midterm, finals plus a few short assignments and a presentation.

Structure and complex chemical structures are not required to be memorized as the instructor often stress understanding is more important than memorization.
